comments:
I20040506

UITestApplication.getApplication(String[]) checks for runnable instanceof
IPlatformRunnable on line 62... however, you're testing against
org.eclipse.core.boot.IPlatformRunnable, not
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPlatformRunnable.  The one in boot has been
deprecated.  You will have to check for both.  UI has recently broken away from
the deprecated class and as such all plugin launches will not currently launch.
 They fail silently but produce the following OSGi log in the launch directory
(.metadata/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/launchname):

!SESSION May 10, 2004 09:26:53.31 ----------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

org.eclipse.ui.tests -classnames org.eclipse.ui.tests.api.StickyViewTest

!MESSAGE Application error

Created an attachment (id=10450)
Patch against org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime

A patch that will allow launching to continue.	I dont know if this is how you
guys are going to want to handle it or not...

A reminder that PDE-Build is the component that deals with the generation of the
build.xml files. PDE-UI deals with plug-in development, runtime workbenches, etc
etc.

The fix you entered...unless I'm mistaken, it will fail if your target plaform
is an older version of eclipse that still uses the IPlatformRunnable in boot...

It it is an older version of Eclipse, then LegacyUITestApplication will be 
executed, not UITestApplication.

Also note that UITestApplication implements ITestHarness, which obviously did 
not exist in 2.x platforms.

I've reverted IDEApplication to use the old IPlatformRunnable so we can run our
tests today.
Clearly I should have tested the change in the first place <g>.
We'll have to remember to put your change back in for the build submission today.

There's no rush to put it back in.  The change in PDE will still work since
org.eclipse.core.boot.IPlatformRunnable extends
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPlatformRunnable.  I'd prefer to wait until we have
the fix in PDE in the build.

>The change in PDE will still work since 
>org.eclipse.core.boot.IPlatformRunnable extends 
>org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPlatformRunnable.

Those PDE guys have thought of everything :-)
